alert.note: Alert for Cass (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 11:10AM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Fremont, northwestern Montgomery, Mills, eastern Pottawattamie and east central Cass Counties through 1145 AM CST... At 1110 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Pacific Junction, or 26 miles southeast of Omaha, moving northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Glenwood and Malvern around 1115 AM CST. Treynor around 1125 AM CST. Carson and Macedonia around 1130 AM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oakland. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 20 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
